alert.note: Alert for Eastern Curry County and Josephine County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 5:08PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Josephine County through 545 PM PDT... At 508 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sam Brown Campground, or 18 miles north of Cave Junction. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and up to penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sam Brown Campground, Briggs Creek Recreation Site and Spalding Pond Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Curry County and Josephine County
